stories.text:
Hello my shape changed a lot since i was a kid,and thats totally normal,but some changes are so extreme that they concern me, my hair became much worse,and i mean MUCH worse,it isnt as black,smooth,silky,shiny or thick as it used to,my nose also became taller(downwards),thinner,thinner from top and thicker from bottom,my nose holes are both tighter and a big meat wiggly ball formed at the tip, my lips became rounder and smaller,and a white border appeared at the top and right bottom,my eyes are lazier and my eyebrows are rounder,my eye also seems smaller for a some reason, my face is longer,thinner at the middle and thicker where the forehead and cheeks are.the back of my head also became really weird,its tall and elongated sorta,my head looks like some sort of pear fruit,my two side profiles are absolutely disgusting.

My body is so tall and thin,my spine is leaning inwards at the middle, but leans outward at the top,its just weird,i wish i could put images here. What is the reason this happened?and can some of these problems be fixed?please help cause im so desperate right now.
stories.title: My Shape Changed Drastically
Snow cover in the European Alps (2021)
Love Blocks – Code Editor for LÖVE
How to build the world’s most realistic robot
How to get what you want now: best books on success

stories.text:
After reading the recent HN article about why buying the dip may not work [0], I started reviewing my personal retirement strategy and began wondering how other HN readers approach the subject. As for me, I plan on using a modified bucket strategy [1] using 2 buckets instead of three (since the savings rates are too low). My plan is to keep 2-3 years of living expenses in a high-interest savings account with the the second bucket in various S&P500 index funds (VOO, VOOG, etc). Every few years, I plan on pulling out some cash to refill the bucket (assuming market conditions are positive). Even with the recent market dip, I am confident this is still the best strategy for me.

Curious as to what other HN readers are using for their retirement strategy...

[0] https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31287464 [1] https://smartasset.com/retirement/retirement-bucket-strategy#:~:text=The%20retirement%20bucket%20strategy%20is%20an%20investment%20approach%20that%20segregates,%2C%20intermediate%20and%20long-term.
stories.title: Ask HN: What is your personal retirement strategy?
